content.body: I presented the latest updates of compartment proposal and having some question from the JSCIG
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I presented the latest updates of compartment proposal and having some question from the JSCIG

content.body: Why "loader" will provides the virtualization of the global object? They looks overlap with ShadowRealm
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Why "loader" will provides the virtualization of the global object? They looks overlap with ShadowRealm

content.body: Actually I'm also curious about this problem. If I have Compartment proposal, ShadowRealm is useless to me. It is hard to use and not provide more abilities than compartment (when the intrinsic are froze).
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Actually I'm also curious about this problem. If I have Compartment proposal, ShadowRealm is useless to me. It is hard to use and not provide more abilities than compartment (when the intrinsic are froze).

content.body: There is indeed some overlap, and some of that falls out naturally from the nesting of the dolls: Every realm is among other things a loader. And there will be some subtlety to whether a Realm or a Compartment is a good fit for a particular use case.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: There is indeed some overlap, and some of that falls out naturally from the nesting of the dolls: Every realm is among other things a loader. And there will be some subtlety to whether a Realm or a Compartment is a good fit for a particular use case.

content.body: One big difference is that a Loader-with-a-new-global comes with only three fresh intrinsics: new evaluators bound to the compartment.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: One big difference is that a Loader-with-a-new-global comes with only three fresh intrinsics: new evaluators bound to the compartment.

content.body: Consequently, module instances can be shared between loaders, whereas module instances cannot be shared between realms.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Consequently, module instances can be shared between loaders, whereas module instances cannot be shared between realms.

content.body: Static module records can of course be shared in both cases.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Static module records can of course be shared in both cases.
